title: Bug 18934 Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB:
Build F2 (20020602)
Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only)
Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don't have any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they don't do anything.
EB:
The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled.
When opening the example application, the scrollbars should not be enabled even though they are visible. They should not be movable and should not have any effect when trying to scroll.
SR:
Build F2 (20020602)
Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only)
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
2. Check the scrollbars to ensure they are enabled.
3. Attempt to move the scrollbars and observe that they do not have any effect.
4. Open a small image, like an icon, to verify that the scrollbars are just misleading and do not scroll.
